paper_title.ja: Antinociceptive constituents of Auricularia polytricha（共著）

description.en: Ceramide (1), cerevisterol (3beta,5alpha,6beta-trihydroxyergosta-7,22-diene) (2) and 9-hydroxycerevisterol (3beta,5alpha,6beta,9alpha-tetrahydroxyergosta-7,22-diene) (3) were isolated from the CH2Cl2 extract and cerebroside (4) was isolated from the MeOH extract of the fruiting bodies of Auricularia poll and identified as the antinociceptive components using the acetic acid-induced writhing method.

Ceramide (1), cerevisterol (3beta,5alpha,6beta-trihydroxyergosta-7,22-diene) (2) and 9-hydroxycerevisterol (3beta,5alpha,6beta,9alpha-tetrahydroxyergosta-7,22-diene) (3) were isolated from the CH2Cl2 extract and cerebroside (4) was isolated from the MeOH extract of the fruiting bodies of Auricularia poll and identified as the antinociceptive components using the acetic acid-induced writhing method.

Antiallergic activity of Curcuma longa((]G0002[))Features of inhibitory actions on histamine release from mast cells
Antiallergic activity of Curcuma longa((]G0001[))Effectiveness of extracts containing curcuminoids
Stimulatory effect of dibutyryl cyclic GMP on acid secretion in mouse isolated stomach and on histamine release in gastric mucosal cells

description.en: We previously reported that endogenous nitric oxide (NO) is involved in the peripheral control of gastric acid secretion induced by some secretagogues, and that endogenous NO is involved in the acid secretion process via histamine release from histamine-containing cells. However, the stimulus-secretion coupling in the cells remains to be clarified. In the present study, we investigated the effect of dibutyryl cyclic GMP on gastric acid secretion in mouse isolated stomach and on histamine release in gastric mucosal cells, in comparison with those of dibutyryl cyclic AMP. Dibutyryl cyclic GMP (300 mu M) produced a slight but significant increase of gastric acid secretion, which was completely inhibited by the histamine-H2 receptor antagonist famotidine. In contrast, dibutyryl cyclic GMP (1 mM) markedly inhibited histamine-induced acid secretion. Dibutyryl cyclic AMP (100 mu M) produced a sustained increase of gastric acid secretion. The pretreatment with famotidine partially inhibited dibutyryl cyclic AMP-induced gastric acid secretion. Dibutyryl cyclic GMP and dibutyryl cyclic AMP significantly increased the histamine release from gastric mucosal cells. These results suggest that both intraceLluIar cyclic GMP and cyclic AMP act as second messengers for histamine release in the histamine-containing cells, probably ECL cells. On the other hand, in gastric parietal cells, cyclic AMP has a stimulatory effect on gastric acid secretion, whereas cyclic GMP has an inhibitory effect. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science Ltd. Published by editions scientifiques et medicales Elsevier SAS.
